name: Accumulation point - Encyclopedia of Mathematicsencyclopediaofmath.org › wiki › Accumulation_point
description: In a discrete space, no set has an accumulation point. The set of all accumulation points of a set A in a space X is called the derived set (of A). In a T1-space, every neighbourhood of an accumulation point of a set contains infinitely many points of the set.
